DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to a number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability. A scoring system of disease severity in patients with end-stage liver disease Model for End Stage Liver Disease (MELD) MELD score.  It is used to help prioritize allocation of liver allografts for transplantation and replaces the Child-Pugh score.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Model for End Stage Liver Disease (MELD) MELD score.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Hepatic Disease or Disorder MELD - Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Model for End Stage Liver Disease (MELD) MELD score.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Model for End Stage Liver Disease (MELD) MELD score.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scoring system of disease severity in patients with end-stage liver disease. It is used to help prioritize allocation of liver allografts for transplantation and replaces the Child-Pugh score. A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
